bioghist.p: Lawrence Meredith Clemson Smith (1902-1975) was a U.S. government official and Philadelphia civic leader. He was the chairman of the Philadelphia Board of Trade and Conventions from 1955 to 1963 and the U.S. vice-chairman of UNESCO. His wife, Eleanor Houston Smith (1910-1987 was a Distinguished Daughter of Pennsylvania, served two terms on the Historical Commission of Pennsylvania, and was a longtime member of the Board of Governors of the Nature Conservancy. Lawrence and Eleanor were early conservationists and helped to establish the Schuylkill Valley Nature Center. They had six children.

scopecontent.p: Photographs and negatives, clippings, school pamphlets, and telegrams documenting the Smiths and their activities as a family. The collection also includes index cards stating the preferences of the Smith family children regarding family art, books, and furniture.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
